meaningMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an い on the end, but wait! It's not an adjective, it's just a noun (tricky, tricky). The kanji means <kanji>grief</kanji>, so this word means <vocabulary>grief</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>distress</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You learned this reading when you learned 憂える. Remember that and you'll remember this!
